objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioNotSupportChannelNotify HUAWEI-WLAN-DEVICE-MIB::hwApIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-WLAN-DEVICE-MIB::hwApMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioID u 9999 HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioMngChannelBandwidth i 1 HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioMngChannel u 9999 HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioActualChannelBandwidth i 1 HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioActualChannel u 9999

description: Ap index, is used to identify AP uniquely.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-DEVICE-MIB::hwApIndex

description: Ap's mac address.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-DEVICE-MIB::hwApMac

description: A exclusive identifier of a radio.
The range of the radio id is from 0 to 3, and the default radio id is 0.
Notes the setting of radio id must insure the radio of a AP exist.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioID

description: An object is used to describing the bandwidth that the AP support .You can config the AP bandwidth by the hwRadioMngChannelBandwidth
but the AP may be not working on value of the your config bandwidth. you can get the actual bandwidth by hwRadioWorkingChannelBandwidth.
At present, 802.11n AP supports three kinds of bandwidth listed in the enum, and 802.11a/b/g AP just only supports HT20(1).
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioMngChannelBandwidth

description: An object uses to set the channel of a radio.
The value of the channel is decided by the channel mode.Such as ,the enum value of channel is 1, 6, 11 on the condition of the 80211 b/g channel mode
the enum value of channel is 36, 40, 44, 48, 52, 56, 60, 64, 149, 153,157, 161 on the condition80 of 80211a channel mode.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioMngChannel

description: Description.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioActualChannelBandwidth

description: An object uses to display the actual working channel which is currently used by the radio.
Notes the radio actual working channel just can be display, but can't be configured.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioActualChannel

description: Description.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioNotSupportPowerLevelNotify HUAWEI-WLAN-DEVICE-MIB::hwApIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-WLAN-DEVICE-MIB::hwApMac s EXAMPL HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioID u 9999 HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioMngPowerLevel u 9999 HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioActualPowerLevel i 9999

description: Ap index, is used to identify AP uniquely.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-DEVICE-MIB::hwApIndex

description: Ap's mac address.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-DEVICE-MIB::hwApMac

description: A exclusive identifier of a radio.
The range of the radio id is from 0 to 3, and the default radio id is 0.
Notes the setting of radio id must insure the radio of a AP exist.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioID

description: An object uses to set the power level of a radio. The range of the power level of a radio is from 0 to 3.
the power of power level 0 is the maximum power, the power of power level 1 is a half of the maximum power,
the power of power level 2 is a quarter of the maximum power, the power of power level 3 is one of eight equal parts of the maximum power.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioMngPowerLevel

description: Description.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-RADIO-MIB::hwRadioActualPowerLevel

description: Description.

description: Ap's mac address.
variables.name: HUAWEI-WLAN-DEVICE-MIB::hwApMac

description: A exclusive identifier of a radio.
The range of the radio id is from 0 to 3, and the default radio id is 0.
Notes the setting of radio id must insure the radio of a AP exist.

description: Description.

description: Description.

event.Summary: Roaming user count on AP ($v2) exceeded threshold
